p: Mitigation and defeat of emerging infections have surfaced as the two major public-health approaches in controlling the virus ( 16). It is vital to reduce COVID-19 infection via minimizing human-to-human contact, which may, however, be publicly and economically unsustainable in the long term ( 17). A crucial infection control or preventive measure would include development of a vaccine. As of now, no licensed vaccine is available against this novel coronavirus, though quite a few are in various phases of clinical trial ( 8, 9).
